# sdwan_system_ca_certificate_feature (Resource)

This resource can manage a System CA Certificate Feature.
  - Minimum SD-WAN Manager version: `20.13.0`

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "sdwan_system_ca_certificate_feature" "example" {
  name               = "Example"
  description        = "My Example"
  feature_profile_id = "f6dd22c8-0b4f-496c-9a0b-6813d1f8b8ac"
  certificates = [
    {
      trust_point_name  = "example"
      ca_certificate_id = "22a2f715-fed8-4031-b693-b5d43451a05e"
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `feature_profile_id` (String) Feature Profile ID
- `name` (String) The name of the Feature

### Optional

- `certificates` (Attributes List) Thirdparty CA Certificate List (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--certificates))
- `description` (String) The description of the Feature

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The id of the Feature
- `version` (Number) The version of the Feature

<a id="nestedatt--certificates"></a>
### Nested Schema for `certificates`

Optional:

- `ca_certificate_id` (String) UUID of Certificate Record in Database
- `trust_point_name` (String) Trust Point Name of Certificate

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# Expected import identifier with the format: "system_ca_certificate_feature_id,feature_profile_id"
terraform import sdwan_system_ca_certificate_feature.example "f6b2c44c-693c-4763-b010-895aa3d236bd,f6dd22c8-0b4f-496c-9a0b-6813d1f8b8ac"
```
